intro: Exomis axyrioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed exomis, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. Exomis axyrioides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
